title: Will the U.S. Education Department's plan to lower monthly payments for student loan borrowers be fully implemented by July 2024?
body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the U.S. Education Department's plan to lower monthly payments for student loan borrowers is fully implemented. 'Fully implemented' means that the plan is operational and affecting the monthly payments of student loan borrowers as intended by the policy. The implementation must be confirmed by official announcements from the U.S. Education Department and reported by at least two reputable news organizations (e.g., The New York Times, Washington Post, BBC). This question resolves as YES upon confirmation of the full implementation.

article_information.article_description: A federal appeals court has allowed the U.S. Education Department to move ahead with a plan to lower monthly payments for millions of student loan borrowers, putting on hold a ruling last week by a lower court. The ruling from the 10th U.S. Circuit Court of A…

title: Will Chicken Soup for the Soul Entertainment emerge from Chapter 11 bankruptcy protection by July 2024?
body: This question will resolve as YES if Chicken Soup for the Soul Entertainment, the parent company of Redbox, successfully emerges from Chapter 11 bankruptcy protection by July 31, 2024. Emergence from Chapter 11 bankruptcy protection is defined as the company having a court-approved reorganization plan and resuming normal business operations. The resolution will be confirmed by reports from at least two reputable news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post). If no such emergence is reported by the end of July 2024, the question resolves as NO.

The resolution will be based on the cumulative amount of debt eliminated, as reported by these sources.

title: Will Joe Biden remain a candidate in the 2024 Presidential race by July 2024?
body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, Joe Biden is still officially a candidate in the 2024 Presidential race. Official candidacy is defined by being listed as a candidate by the Federal Election Commission (FEC) or by making public statements confirming his candidacy. This must be reported by at least two reputable news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post).
